misconceptions.text: If an image shows a person, the text must be about that specific person.
misconceptions.correction: The text might be about a different person or a general statement about people.

misconceptions.text: An image of a location automatically verifies any text about that location.
misconceptions.correction: The image must specifically show the events or conditions described in the text.

misconceptions.text: If an image is real, any text associated with it must be true.
misconceptions.correction: Real images can be used with misleading or false text.

misconceptions.text: The presence of certain objects in an image proves the text is true.
misconceptions.correction: Objects must be relevant to the specific claims in the text.

misconceptions.text: If an image is recent, it must be related to current events mentioned in the text.
misconceptions.correction: Recent images can be used to illustrate unrelated or historical events.

misconceptions.text: The emotional content of an image validates emotional claims in the text.
misconceptions.correction: Emotional content must be specifically related to the claims made.

misconceptions.text: If an image shows a specific action, the text must be about that exact action.
misconceptions.correction: The action shown must be directly related to the claims in the text.

misconceptions.text: The quality of an image indicates the truthfulness of the text.
misconceptions.correction: Image quality is independent of text accuracy.
